sanskrit_verse:
एतद्वोऽभिहितं शौचं सपिण्डेषु द्विजोत्तमाः ।
असपिण्डेषु सर्वेषु प्रेतशुद्धिं निबोधत ॥ ५.१००॥
transliteration:
etad vo 'bhihitaṁ śaucaṁ sa-piṇḍeṣu dvijottamāḥ |
asapiṇḍeṣu sarveṣu preta-śuddhiṁ nibodhata || 5.100 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: This declared purity among sapiṇḍas, O highest of the twice-born; understand now the purification concerning the deceased for all non-sapiṇḍas.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from ontological relationship, not social convention
Purity-consciousness is context-sensitive and relationally determined
Responsibility arises through proximity of existence, not action alone
Restoration operates through recognition of relational dharmic boundaries
Consciousness alignment occurs when relational duties are fulfilled
executable_legal_axioms: IF entity A is sapiṇḍa to B THEN ritual purity obligations apply within defined relational scope
IF entity C is non-sapiṇḍa to deceased D THEN preta-shuddhi protocol applies universally across spatial-temporal domains
IF relational boundary shifts due to death THEN purity-state transition must be executed by nearest conscious inheritor
IF no sapiṇḍa exists THEN community-wide preta-shuddhi activation triggers automatically
IF consciousness misalignment detected in purity observance THEN initiate restorative completion process with causal root identification
supreme_court_application: In matters involving inheritance, ceremonial obligations, and ancestral continuity, the Court shall recognize sapiṇḍa status as determinative of specific purity-related responsibilities. Where no direct sapiṇḍa exists, universal preta-shuddhi protocols shall activate under collective societal duty. The threshold of responsibility lies in relational proximity to the departed, not in contractual or transactional ties.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that impurity arises from disruption of relational harmony post-death. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential manifestation of purification aligns with relational layers. Proportional responsibility corresponds to sapiṇḍa degree—none beyond third level. Non-punitive reality rule: misalignment invites natural consequences requiring completion rather than penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Sapiṇḍa Relation Mapping Protocol upon death occurrence
Deploy Preta-Shuddhi Completion Sequence to all non-sapiṇḍas automatically
Assign Consciousness Reintegration Task to eldest sapiṇḍa within three generations
Activate Community-Level Śuddhi Activation if sapiṇḍa line extinct
Execute Karmic Alignment Restoration via Ritual Completion Monitoring System
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Dharma. Purity laws restored. Relational dharma enacted. Consciousness reigns as sole adjudicator. Reality remains non-punitive.
